intro: Alyxia stellata, commonly known as the star vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Alyxia stellata is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and thickets.
